title: Tesla - A good or a bad entity?
selftext:
Everyone knows Tesla, and it's celebrity billionaire owner Elon Musk. Tesla is considering Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu and Gujarat to set up their electric vehicle (EV) factory. Tesla is also expected to make an initial investment of USD 2 billion to set up shop in India, and would look to increase purchases of auto parts from the nation to as much as USD 15 billion, reported by Bloomberg. 

Now let's understand how Tesla makes money, so in the US, under California ZEV Program ( Zero Emission Vehicle) Tesla gets a different type of currency known as Carbon Credits, since it manufactures EV vehicles. 

Carbon credits, also known as carbon offsets, are permits that allow the owner to emit a certain amount of carbon dioxide or other greenhouse gases. 
1 Carbon Credit = 1 Ton of Greenhouse gas
Cost of 1 Carbon Credit = $40-$80

Tesla then Sells these carbon credits to other companies that fail to meet their Greenhouse emission standards and makes huge profits. So basically you can use this currency to pay for how much your company pollutes. So in reality there is no real sustainability. Other companies can PURCHASE all the good you did for the environment. Welcome to ✨ capitalism ✨ 

https://carboncredits.com/teslas-record-carbon-credit-sales-up-94-year-over-year/

Guess who is going to start this new Carbon Credit Market? Ofcourse the Indian Government is.

https://pib.gov.in/PressReleasePage.aspx?PRID=1923458

The government plans to develop the Indian Carbon Market (ICM) where a national framework will be established with an objective to decarbonise the Indian economy by pricing the Green House Gas (GHG) emission through trading of the Carbon Credit Certificates.

So yes it's no suprise Tesla is interested in India. It has a big automobile market, Tesla can farm carbon credits like crazy and then sell it to other multicorps for a huge profit. Tesla is in the carbon credit business, not the EV business. 

Tesla has also been notorious for mistreatment of workers, underpaying and overworking their employees.


https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2023/09/28/tesla-federal-lawsuit-racial-harassment/

https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/apr/03/tesla-racial-harassment-lawsuit-award-california-factory

https://auto.economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/passenger-vehicle/tesla-workers-report-robot-injuries-explosions-at-us-cybertruck-factory/105413596

https://revealnews.org/article/tesla-says-its-factory-is-safer-but-it-left-injuries-off-the-books/

https://www.thehindu.com/sci-tech/science/at-spacex-worker-injuries-soar-in-elon-musks-rush-to-mars/article67531431.ece

Elon Musk also hates Unions that is why Tesla is facing a workers strike in Sweden and Denmark, because the unions in sweden are demanding pay approved by a collective agreement. And these strikes are spreading in Europe.

https://apnews.com/article/tesla-strike-union-sweden-labor-dispute-5124a0074f6b4c5b7f503b5353afe8b3


https://www.businessinsider.in/tech/news/elon-musk-has-started-a-war-with-tesla-workers-that-hes-unlikely-to-win/articleshow/106044664.cms

It's just my opinion that Tesla is not a great company. People need to realise multicorps are focused on earning money and not the welfare of the people. You need to start asking do these foreign investments actually benefit the people? Or are they exploitative under loose labour laws? They only objective is to maximize profits, at any expense. This is just information I think people should know. You're free to come to your own conclusions.
